Uses of Interface
org.smtlib.sexpr.ILexToken

  • Packages that use ILexToken 
    Package Description
    org.smtlib.sexpr
    This package is a concrete implementation of a particular concrete syntax for the abstract SMT-LIB semantics.

    • Uses of ILexToken in org.smtlib.sexpr

      Subinterfaces of ILexToken in org.smtlib.sexpr 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Lexer.IPLexToken
      An interface used for punctuation tokens that can be retrieved from the parser input.
      Classes in org.smtlib.sexpr that implement ILexToken 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Lexer.EOD
      A class that represents a lexical token corresponding to the end of input
      private static class  Lexer.LexBinaryLiteral 
      private static class  Lexer.LexDecimal 
      private static class  Lexer.LexError 
      private static class  Lexer.LexHexLiteral 
      private static class  Lexer.LexKeyword 
      private static class  Lexer.LexNumeral 
      private static class  Lexer.LexStringLiteral 
      private static class  Lexer.LexSymbol 
      protected class  Lexer.LexToken
      A lexical token class for single punctuation characters.
      Fields in org.smtlib.sexpr declared as ILexToken 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private ILexToken Lexer.nextToken
      Holds the lookahead token - should only be read and written by peekToken/getToken; value is null if we have not gotten the next lexical token yet.
      ILexToken Parser.savedlp
      This field is used to communicate the beginning LP while parsing commands
      Methods in org.smtlib.sexpr that return ILexToken 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ILexToken Lexer.getToken()
      Returns the next lexical token, advancing the scanner.
      ILexToken Lexer.getToken(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
      Returns the next lexical token; if the token returned matches the given class (or is a subclass), then the scanner is advanced; if the token does not match, the scanner is not advanced.
      protected ILexToken Lexer.getToken(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher)
      Returns the next token found in the given matcher, advancing the matcher
      ILexToken Lexer.getToken(java.lang.String text)
      Returns the first token found in the given text
      ILexToken Parser.parseLP()
      Parses a left parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed)
      ILexToken Parser.parseRP()
      Parses a right parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed)
      ILexToken Parser.parseRP(java.lang.String msg)
      Parses a right parenthesis, returning null and emitting an error message if there isn't one (and the next token is not consumed); the error message is the argument, with any '# character replaced by the kind() of the actual next token.
      ILexToken Lexer.peekToken()
      Returns the next lexical token without consuming it; a subsequent call to getToken will return the same token.
      Methods in org.smtlib.sexpr with parameters of type ILexToken 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Parser.error(java.lang.String msg, ILexToken token)
      Emits an error message consisting of the given message string with any '#' character in the string replaced by the kind() of the second argument; the position of the error is the position of the given token.
      private IExpr.IAsIdentifier Parser.parseAsIdentifierRest(ILexToken lp)
      Parses an 'as' identifier, presuming the left-paren and the 'as' are already parsed, from the token stream, returning null (with logged error messages) if there is not one.
      private IExpr.IIdentifier Parser.parseIdentifierRest(ILexToken lp)
      Parses a parameterized identifier from the token stream, presuming the left parenthesis and the underscore character are already read, return null with logged error messages if there is not one.
      Sexpr.Seq Parser.parseSeq(ILexToken lp)
      Parses and adds Sexpr to a list until parseSexpr returns null (indicating a RightParen has been seen or end of input or an error)
